alert.note: Alert for Lipscomb; Ochiltree (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 08 at 3:24PM CST until January 09 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations up to three inches. Winds gusting as high as 65 mph. * WHERE...In Oklahoma, Beaver County. In Texas, Lipscomb and Ochiltree Counties. * WHEN...Until 6 AM CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Visibilities may drop below 1/4 mile due to falling and blowing snow. Whiteout conditions are expected and will make travel treacherous and potentially life-threatening. Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday evening and Tuesday morning commutes. Very strong winds could cause extensive damage to trees and power lines.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel extremely dangerous. Do not travel. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you and notify a friend or family of your plans. If you get stranded, stay in your vehicle. In Oklahoma, call 844-465-4997 for road information. In Texas, call 800-452-9292 for road information.
